Question: Which of these is only found outside the solar system?

Choices:
A: planets
B: moons
C: nebulae
D: comets
steps: Planets are found both within and outside our solar system; for example, exoplanets orbiting other stars qualify as planets beyond our solar system.
Moons, by definition, orbit planets. Since moons are tied to planets, they are inherently located within our solar system.
Comets are also part of our solar system and can be observed within it, particularly as they approach the sun.
Nebulae are vast clouds of gas and dust in space that can be found in various parts of the universe, including only outside of our solar system.
